}} The '2002â03 Football League Cup' was the 43rd staging of the Football League
Cup, a knockout competition for England's top 92 football clubs. The competition
name reflects a sponsorship deal with lager brand Worthington.

The competition began on 10 August 2002, and ended with the final on 2
March 2003.

The tournament was won by Liverpool, who beat Manchester United 2â0 in the
final, thanks to goals from Michael Owen and Steven Gerrard.
